block.p: Lauren Allegra Charles, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Norman C. Charles of New York, was married last evening to Kevin David Wolf, a son of Judith Wolf and Stephen Wolf, both of New York. Rabbi Richard Chapin officiated at the Essex House in New York.

Mrs. Wolf, 27, graduated magna cum laude from New York University, where in September she is to begin studying for a master's degree in social work. Her father is a clinical professor of ophthalmology at the New York University School of Medicine. He also has an ophthalmology practice in New York; the bride's mother manages that office.

Lauren Allegra Charles, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Norman C. Charles of New York, was married last evening to Kevin David Wolf, a son of Judith Wolf and Stephen Wolf, both of New York. Rabbi Richard Chapin officiated at the Essex House in New York.

Mrs. Wolf, 27, graduated magna cum laude from New York University, where in September she is to begin studying for a master's degree in social work. Her father is a clinical professor of ophthalmology at the New York University School of Medicine. He also has an ophthalmology practice in New York; the bride's mother manages that office.

Mr. Wolf, 28, graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania and received an M.B.A. degree last month from Columbia University. In September, he is to become an associate at Lehman Brothers, the New York investment bank. His mother is the administrative director at Metropolitan Oral Surgery Associates in New York. His father owns the State Painting and Decorating Company in New York. The bridegroom is a stepson of Roberta Tepper.
